author: pipermerriam
content: I think this must be mitigated against on the client side since there are legitimate situations where a load balanced connection across different connections could result in different packets coming from different ports and ip addresses. And, a malicious node could just send you junk to try and disrupt the network.

content: Agreed. I'm currently using a majority (over a moving window) of 10 peers. So it seems  a good portion of the peers I contact see one port and the other portion see another. I plan on doing some more investigations today, will report back if I find anything interesting
